intro: Tococa chuivensis, commonly known as the Andean tea plant, is a shrub native to the cloud forests of northern South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by elliptical, dark blue berries. Its leaves are often used to make a stimulating beverage similar to yerba mate. Tococa chuivensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is also used in traditional Andean rituals.
